bug.author: vinayjain15
bug.summary: Central dashboard notebook servers encounters internal server error
bug.description:
/kind bug
[A clear and concise description of what the bug is.] I am trying to deploy kubeflow on prem openshift cluster using ksonnet the issue looks similar to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/3441>#3441</denchmark-link> though I am not getting cert error in the logs however it says self signed certificate in certificate chain. There is no other errors in the centraldashboard or notebook logs. What did you expect to happen: In Central dashboard when you click on new server , it would have opened page to select image however it is giving error The server encountered an internal error and was unable to complete your request. Either the server is overloaded or there is an error in the application. Anything else you would like to add: [Miscellaneous information that will assist in solving the issue.] <denchmark-h:h2>root@jupyter-web-app-deployment: openssl s_client -connect kubernetes.default.svc:443 CONNECTED(00000003) depth=1 CN = openshift-signer@1563472500 verify error:num=19:self signed certificate in certificate chain</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>Certificate chain 0 s:/CN=172.30.0.1 i:/CN=openshift-signer@1563472500 1 s:/CN=openshift-signer@1563472500 i:/CN=openshift-signer@1563472500</denchmark-h>
Server certificate -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- <denchmark-h:h2>-----END CERTIFICATE----- subject=/CN=172.30.0.1 issuer=/CN=openshift-signer@1563472500</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>SSL handshake has read 2515 bytes and written 273 bytes Verification error: self signed certificate in certificate chain</denchmark-h>
SSL-Session: Protocol : TLSv1.2 <denchmark-code>PSK identity: None PSK identity hint: None SRP username: None Verify return code: 19 (self signed certificate in certificate chain) Extended master secret: no </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): 0.5.0 kfctl version: (use kfctl version): Kubernetes platform: (e.g. minikube) openshift 3.11 Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): v1.11.0+d4cacc0 OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): RHEL 7.6

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.98. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

studyjobcontroller is failing and log has following entry: not sure if it is related to above issue: oc logs studyjob-controller-7bbcfd66f8-zvhjd 2019/08/22 23:19:29 Registering Components. 2019/08/22 23:19:29 Starting the Cmd. 2019/08/22 23:19:30 can't create dir: k8s-webhook-server/cert

I was able to fix above issue .. it was related to storageclass.. one of the storageclass was not having any annotations and it had an error in jupyter-web-app, somehow I missed that. However now after connecting to tensorflow notebook (tensorflow-1.13.1-notebook-cpu) when I launch python notebook, it gives error: A connection to the notebook server could not be established. The notebook will continue trying to reconnect. Check your network connection or notebook server configuration. shows following in chrome devtools. There is no error in pod. kernel.js:461 WebSocket connection to 'ws://ambassador-kubeflow.devgpu.tent.trt.csaa.pri/notebook/kubeflow/user1/api/kernels/faf4a293-c4dc-4352-bdf2-c20518bb5452/channels?session_id=a100a48bbf3749d181ae7a6fc8095afc' failed: Error during WebSocket handshake: net::ERR_CONNECTION_RESET
what kfctl version are you using? we don't support ksonnet in v0.6+ - did you try using kubeflow/manifests/jupyter?
I was able to resolve the issue by configuring ambassador service with nodeport instead of using clusterip.
